result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick D Butler

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patrick D Butler in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu for Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Patrick D Butler.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requesting one more status.
Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Original Warrant filed with the court.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER ALL CASES 22CM352, 21CT306 & 21CM266 (CASH ALREADY POSTED)

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without an IID installed.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Patrick D Butler in court, in custody, via video.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Patrick D Butler.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant in custody in Rock County Jail when warrants were issued. Warrant quashed. Court to vacate bond forfeiture. Cash bond reinstated. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on September 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
